oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Muster-in roll of 2nd Lieutenant John B. Turner, 5th Tennessee Cavalry, U. S. A.
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865 -- Registers, lists, etc.; United States -- Adjutant-General's Office; United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865 -- Recruiting & enlistment; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This printed form with handwritten entries records Lieutenant Jojn B. Turner's entrance into military service, acceptance of the terms of service, and the verification of his commanding and mustering officers.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States -- Adjutant-General's Office
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The term "muster roll" often calls to mind Civil War company muster rolls, but an initial muster-in roll for an individual soldier, such as this one, is quite illustrative. The directions to the mustering officer printed at the bottom of the form highlight the multiple copies that were produced of Civil War official military forms. In this case, four copies were to be made and sent to the appropriate entities on national and state levels to ensure proper recording of enrollment and payment.
